operations.description: Updates a buyer account by id. You can modify all the fields on the object account, including custom fields defined in the fields definition section of your admin portal.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

operations.description: Deletes a buyer account. Deleting an account removes all users, applications, service subscriptions to the account.

operations.description: Approves the account (changes the state to live). Accounts need to be approved explictly via the API after creation. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Rejects the account (changes the state to rejected). An account can be rejected after creation, the workflow of the account creation can have a validation process that ends up in approving or rejecting the account submission. The state can also be updated by PUT on /admin/api/accounts/{id}.xml

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Resets the state of the account to pending. So that it can be again approved or rejected.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Updates the JSON spec of the ActiveDoc by id. To create, delete and update description and state of Active Docs you must use the Admin Portal. This request only allows to update the JSON spec (body) service, useful when the JSON spec is generated programmatically (for instance using source2swagger). Once you have the JSON spec you can updload to be live straight away, for instance: 'curl -v -X PUT -F "body= YOUR_JSON_SPEC_FILE" https://YOUR-API_PORTAL.3scale.net/admin/api/active_docs/ID.xml?provider_key=YOUR_PROVIDER_KEY'

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON Spec of the ActiveDocs (based on the spec of Swagger).

parameters.description: Name of the application to be created.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the application to be created.

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

parameters.name: provider_key

operations.description: Suspends an application (changes the state to suspended). Suspending an application will stop the application to be authorized on API requests.

operations.description: Creates a new user of the account (account_id). Do not forget to activate it otherwise he will not be able to sign-in, after creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended on the Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove the object's fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

operations.description: Change the state of the user back to active.

operations.description: Activate the user of an account. When a user is created is on the pending state. It needs to be activated before he is able to sign-in.

operations.description: Associates credit card tokens and billing address to an account. This operation is only required if you use your own credit card capture method. Those tokens are the ones required by Authorize.net, ogone, braintree, payment express, merchant e solutions, payflow

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: credit_card_token
parameters.description: The token returned by the payment gateway. Client_id if you're using braintree (In that case, the first credit card will be used)

parameters.name: credit_card_authorize_net_payment_profile_token
parameters.description: Authorize.net payment profile token. Unused for other payment gateways

parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_year
parameters.description: Year of expiration of credit card. 2digit number

parameters.name: credit_card_expiration_month
parameters.description: Month of expiration of credit card. 2digit number

parameters.name: billing_address_name
parameters.description: Name of the person/company to bill

parameters.name: billing_address_address
parameters.description: Address associated to the credit card

parameters.name: credit_card_partial_number
parameters.description: 4 last numbers of the credit card

operations.description: Removes all credit card info of an account.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: This request allows to reproduce a sign-up from a buyer in a single API call. It will create an Account, an admin User for the account and optionally one Application with its keys. If the plan_id are not passed the default plans will be used instead. You can add additional custome parameters that you define in Fields Definition on your Admin Portal.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: org_name
parameters.description: Organization Name of the buyer account.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of the admin user (on the new buyer account).

parameters.name: account_plan_id
parameters.description: id of the account plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: service_plan_id
parameters.description: id of the service plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: application_plan_id
parameters.description: id of the application plan (if not assigned default will be used instead).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

operations.description: Lists the users of the provider account. You can apply filters by state and/or role.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Creates a new user in the provider account. Do not forget to activate it otherwise he will not be able to sign-in, after creation the default state is pending and the default role is member. The user object can be extended on the Fields Definitions in the Admin Portal. You can add/remove the object's fields, for instance token (string), age (int), third name (string optional), etc.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

operations.description: Gets the user of the provider account by id

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Modifies the user of the provider account by id. You can update any field, not only those in the form of the ActiveDocs but all the fields that belong to the User object, remember that you can define you custom fields on your Admin Portal.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.description: Additional fields have to be name and value i.e &name=value. You can add as many as you want. Additional fields cover for the custom fields declared in 'Settings >> Fields Definitions' on your API Admin Portal. Typical examples are 'url', 'country', 'janrain_token', etc. Please check your Fields Definitions to get the list of all your required fields.

operations.description: Deletes the user of the provider account by id

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.summary: User change Role to Member (provider account)
operations.description: Changes the role of the user of the provider account to member

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.summary: User change Role to Admin (provider account)
operations.description: Changes the role of the provider account to admin (full rights and privileges)

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Changes the state of the user of the provider account to suspended, remove the user's ability to sign-in. You can also do this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml setting up the state parameter.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Revokes the suspension of a user of the provider account. You can also do this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml setting up the state parameter.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Changes the state of the user of the provider account to active, to be done after sign-up. You can also do this operation with a PUT on /admin/api/users/{id}.xml setting up the state parameter.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Lists of webhooks that could not be delivered to your end-point after 5 trials. A webhook is considered delivered if your end-point responds with a 200, otherwise it retries 5 times with a 60 seconds gap.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

operations.description: Deletes failed deliveries records. It is advisible to delete the records passing the time of the last webhook failure that was received instead of deleting them all. Between the GET and the DELETE other webhooks failures might have arrived.

parameters.name: provider_key
parameters.description: Your api key with 3scale (also known as provider key).

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Only failed webhook deliveries whose time is less or equal than the passed time are destroyed (if used).
